results.question: Match the term 'cost rate table' to its description:
results.correct_answer: h. resource pay rates that are stored on the Costs tab of the Resource Information dialog box
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource

results.question: Match the term 'underallocated' to its description:
results.correct_answer: e. the work assigned to a resource is less than the resource’s maximum capacity
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource

results.question: Match the term 'variable consumption rate' to its description:
results.correct_answer: d. the amount of the material resource consumed is dependent upon the duration of the task
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource

results.question: Match the term 'units' to its description:
results.correct_answer: i. the portion of a resource’s capacity devoted to work on a specific task
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource

results.question: Match the term 'allocation' to its description:
results.correct_answer: f. the process of delaying or splitting a resource’s work on a task to resolve an overallocation
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource

results.question: Match the term 'fixed consumption rate' to its description:
results.correct_answer: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
incorrect_answers: d. the amount of the material resource consumed is dependent upon the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource

results.question: Match the term 'overallocated' to its description:
results.correct_answer: g. the maximum capacity of a resource to accomplish work
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource

results.question: Match the term 'resource leveling' to its description:
results.correct_answer: c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
f. the process of delaying or splitting a resource’s work on a task to resolve an overallocation

results.question: Match the term 'fully allocated' to its description:
results.correct_answer: b. the total work of a resource’s task assignments is exactly equal to that resource’s work capacity
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource
f. the process of delaying or splitting a resource’s work on a task to resolve an overallocation

results.question: Match the term 'Max. Units' to its description:
results.correct_answer: j. the measurement of a resource’s capacity to work
incorrect_answers: a. an absolute quantity of material resources will be used, no matter the duration of the task
c. a resource is assigned to do more work than can be done within the normal capacity of the resource
f. the process of delaying or splitting a resource’s work on a task to resolve an overallocation

results.question: Resource leveling cannot always resolve all resource overallocations. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: A resource cannot have both a cost per use and a cost derived from its pay rate. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: Resource leveling never changes who is assigned to tasks or the total work value of those assignments. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T

results.question: You can manually resolve a resource overallocation by replacing the overallocated resource with another resource. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: You can assign two types of material consumption rates in Microsoft Project. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T

results.question: The settings in the Resource Leveling dialog box apply to all of the project schedules you work with in Microsoft Project. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: You can have up to six cost rate tables for a resource. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: It is not acceptable to allow a minor overallocation to remain in a schedule. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: F
incorrect_answers: T

results.question: The default rate table in Microsoft Project is Rate Table 1. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F

results.question: When a variable consumption rate is assigned to a material resource, and the duration of the task to which it is assigned changes, so do the calculated amount and cost of the material resource. (T/F)
results.correct_answer: T
incorrect_answers: F
